item.title: Games That Made The News
item.description:
Summary

  • Minecraft's success led to a historic Microsoft acquisition.
  • Rockstar thwarted an Adults Only rating for San Andreas following a controversial mod.
  • The media falsely vilified Mass Effect 2, benefiting its PR in the end.

The video game industry has exploded in the past few decades to become one of the most valuable forms of entertainment media of all time. Movies, music, TV shows, and other media may be notable in their own right, but they don't hold a candle to the sheer amount of money being pumped into the video game industry.

Video games have come a long way from being punching bags for the media, although there are times when some games still stir up a lot of controversy. Thankfully, there is also some positive news surrounding gaming from time to time. Whether for good or bad reasons, all of the following games caused a media stir.

Minecraft

Made The News Several Times, Including A Historic Microsoft Acquisition

6 Images
6 Images
Minecraft
191
9.0 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Minecraft is one of the biggest indie successes of all time. It became a huge game and helped its creator, Notch, become a billionaire after a groundbreaking acquisition deal by Microsoft.

While its creator has come under fire for some of their comments, Minecraft has mostly distanced itself from Notch's questionable views and continues to be one of the best titles players can get their hands on. Hopefully, this groundbreaking game will continue to make the news for positive reasons.

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas

The Hot Coffee Mod Exposed Something That Wasn't Part Of The Final Game

5 Images
5 Images
Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
112
8.6 /10
Released
October 26, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs
Powered by

The Hot Coffee mod is one of the most unnecessary video game controversies of all time. While the decision to add a minigame about intimacy with CJ's girlfriends wasn't the best, Rockstar saw reason at some point in development, and removed this from the final product.

However, the unused files remained in the game. Modders uncovered this content and restored it, causing a media storm for the ages that almost led to San Andreas getting the Adults Only rating. Before this could happen, though, Rockstar removed these game files from the game in an update and ensured that San Andreas would be marketed to the masses with ease.

Mass Effect 2

The Game Was Villified For Something That Was Completely Untrue

Mass Effect 2
8 /10
11
9.1 /10
Released
January 26, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

Mass Effect 2 is one of the greatest video games of all time, but the media was too busy trying to label it as an explicit game. People with misinformation made bold accusations that Mass Effect 2 's intimate scenes were very graphic and showed levels of nudity that were never actually present in the final product.

Of course, this was disproved in no time, but that didn't stop the media from having a field day with this game. It just ended up having the opposite effect, with Mass Effect 2 getting more PR as a result of this media outcry.

Hogwarts Legacy

J.K. Rowling's Horrible Views Caused This Game To Be Trashed

Hogwarts Legacy
9 /10
75
8.7 /10
Released
February 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Hogwarts Legacy was shaping up to be one of the best titles set in the Harry Potter universe. However, J.K. Rowling's hateful comments about trans women dominated the discourse before this game, leading many to boycott the game when it came out.

It was a shame for the developers, especially since they distanced themselves from Rowling's views. Thankfully, the Harry Potter IP was so strong that Hogwarts Legacy shattered multiple records and became one of the best-selling video games of all time, so much so that it unseated Call of Duty from its throne.

Bulletstorm

Fox News Turned This Title Into Their Latest Punching Bag

Bulletstorm
7 /10
7.7 /10
Released
February 22, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Game Experience May Change During Online Play, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

While the outcry against violence in video games has died down in recent times, Fox News has obviously tried to stir the pot now and again for the same of theirratings. One of their more recent targets was Bulletstorm , a game they stated had unnecessarily gory violence.

Of course, most of their claims were overblown and debunked in no time. However, that didn't stop Fox News from sticking to its guns and continuing to spread false information regarding Bulletstorm .

Bully

The Press Missed The Whole Point

Bully
9.2 /10
Released
October 17, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Crude Humor, Language, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

The whole point of Bully was to highlight the evils of bullying, with Jimmy having to win over the school after Gary tricked him and turned him into a laughingstock. However, this theme went over the heads of the media, which wasted no time in accusing Bully of encouraging high school students to commit violent acts.

Given how Rockstar was the media's favorite punching bag when it came to video gaming, it's easy to see why Bully became such an easy target. Once again, Rockstar rode this wave of PR to ensure that more people would be interested in playing Bully .

Path Of Exile 2

Elon Musk's Incompetence At This Game Made Headlines

8 Images
8 Images
Path of Exile II
Action RPG
Systems
9 /10

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Nudity, Violence
Powered by

Path of Exile 2 is a fun and complex action RPG that's as challenging as they come, but the reason why it made the news was for a mostly unrelated reason. Elon Musk has touted himself to be a skilled gamer and decided to livestream himself playing Path of Exile 2 with what seemed like a high-level character he'd spent a ton of hours building up.

However, it was clear that he'd paid someone to level up his character, since Elon was woefully inept at the game and couldn't even defeat the first boss. To make things worse, the chat trolled him by spamming messages lambasting him for ruining the country and pretending to be his ex. Suffice it to say, he ended this livestream in no time, but not before making the news for this unintentional hilarity.

Black Myth: Wukong

The Chinese Game That Made A Major Splash

Black Myth: Wukong
6 /10
114
9.2 /10
Released
August 20, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood, Violence
Powered by

Black Myth: Wukong made it clear that the Chinese market is ripe for gaming. This fun action-adventure Soulslike is the first-ever AAA game from China, and it became one of the most popular and best-selling titles in no time. The incredible action, stellar graphics, and the game's focus on cinematic spectacle made it a blast to play through and led to it selling eighteen million units in just two weeks, a gargantuan feat in the realm of video games.

It was impressive to see the records this title broke when it came out. The sky's the limit for Chinese video game developers now, and it's clear that Wukong 's success will compel more companies to enjoy a slice of this newfound pie.

item.title: Battlefield 2042 Players Aren't Happy With the New Lynx Sniper Rifle
item.description:
Battlefield 2042 received a surprise update yesterday, August 18, but one of the two new weapons added in patch 9.2.0 is already drawing criticisms from the community for its wide bullet spread. The Lynx Sniper Rifle was one of two new weapons added in the unexpected Battlefield 2042 update, but players are already referring to it as "the worst Sniper Rifle in the game," as one fan shows off just how awful the weapon truly is.

At launch, Battlefield 2042 was heavily criticized for a multitude of different reasons. The 2021 shooter took players to a semi-futuristic battlefield with advanced weapons, new maps, and more. Unfortunately, the title didn't receive the love EA and DICE were likely hoping for, as it was blasted with negative reviews from both players and critics. Complaints came flooding in surrounding the lack of server browser, scoreboard, its many bugs and glitches, and more, but DICE remained committed to rectifying the shooter with a steady stream of new updates. With Battlefield 6 on the horizon, 2042 's life cycle is now firmly at its end, but that hasn't stopped the studio from releasing one final update to send the game off in style.

Battlefield 2042 Player Shows the Lynx's Awful Bullet Spread

As the Battlefield 6 open beta came to a close on August 18, DICE gave fans a great reason to jump back into Battlefield 2042 with a new update. Patch 9.2.0 saw the return of Iwo Jima, the Lynx Sniper Rifle, and the KFS2000 Assault Rifle, among many other things. The Lynx Sniper Rifle is currently only available to those who participated in the Battlefield 6 open beta, but DICE has said it will become available "later down the line." With that being said, players who haven't got the weapon don't appear to be missing out. Reddit user AnonymousIndividual recently took to the Battlefield 2042 subreddit to blast the Lynx as "the worst Sniper Rifle in the game," showcasing how its wide bullet spread makes it practically unusable.

The short video shows the user aiming directly at an enemy's head, but somehow still missing the shot completely. "Sometimes it'll hit where you aim, sometimes it won't," the user said. Plenty of other Battlefield 2042 players seem to agree, as fellow user Newsandbuy responded by saying, "This thing is horrible, you either shove your barrel into your enemy's face, or don't try it at all."

The Lynx Sniper Rifle may not have gone down too well with fans, but the update does seem to have brought plenty of fans back to the 2021 title, as Battlefield 2042 's player count is way up, at least on Steam. For the first time in almost a year, Battlefield 2042 has peaked at over 20,000 concurrent players on the platform, and it's all thanks to the game's latest update. Of course, there's also a good chance the players are jumping back in on PlayStation and Xbox too, but the player count numbers from consoles are not public information.

Battlefield 2042 's sudden rise in player count is likely also due to the hype surrounding Battlefield 6 after its recent open beta weekends. Fans are hungry to get their Battlefield fix now that the beta is over, and with a ton of free rewards now available in Battlefield 2042 (some of which can be used in Battlefield 6 at launch), EA and DICE have given the community a great reason to revisit the controversial shooter.

6 Images

item.title: Roblox: Tower Defense Simulator Codes (August 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Tower Defense Simulator Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes In Tower Defense Simulator

There are many experiences in the tower defense genre, but Tower Defence Simulator stands out due to its atmosphere, well-designed maps, and interesting enemies. This article will be useful for Roblox players looking for freebies in this experience. Here they can find a complete list of Tower Defence Simulator codes and information about the rewards that they all offer.

Updated August 19, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are currently no active codes available for Tower Defense Simulator . This can change at any time, so its a good idea to keep an eye on this guide. We update it regularly as new codes and rewards become available. Checking back later ensures you wont miss any future bonuses.

All Tower Defense Simulator Codes

Active Tower Defense Simulator Codes

  • No active codes.

Expired Tower Defense Simulator Codes

  • 4BVisits - Enter this code to claim rewards.
  • EnterCodeHere - Enter this code to claim a Crate.
  • 1POINT7MIL - Enter this code to claim a Farm Tower Skin.
  • TDS5YEARS! - Enter this code to claim a 1 Party Skincrate.
  • MERRY2024 - Enter this code to claim Cookie Scout and 1 Holiday Crate.
  • IMCONSUMING - Enter this code to claim a Mid Grade Consumable Crate.
  • QNJOU11 - Enter this code to claim a Premium Crate.
  • HAPPYHALLOWEEN - Enter this code to claim a Halloween Skin Crate.
  • NAMETAGSRCOOL - Enter this code to claim a Name Tag.
  • JOHNRETURNS - Enter this code to claim the John Skin.
  • M3RRY2022TDS - Enter this code to claim a Cookie Scout.
  • beachglad2022 - Enter this code to claim Beach Gladiator skin.
  • MERRY2021 - Enter this code to claim Present Skin.
  • robloxisback - Enter this code to claim Premium Skincrate.
  • 1BILLION - Enter this code to claim Deluxe Crate.
  • COMMUNITY20 - Enter this code to claim Mini Skin.
  • celebration21 - Enter this code to claim 1 Party Crate.
  • 200KMAY - Enter this code to claim 500 Gems.
  • BLOXY21 - Enter this code to claim Commander Skin.
  • FIFTYK - Enter this code to claim 200 Coins.
  • delayed - Enter this code to claim a Premium Crate.
  • imababy - Enter this code to claim 100 Gems.
  • newyear2021 - Enter this code to claim 1 Premium Crate.
  • 30k - Enter this code to claim 1 Pumpkin Crate.
  • DOUBLEBLOXIES - Enter this code to claim Cowboy Skin.
  • ICYFREEZE - Enter this code to claim Freezer Skin.
  • W33KLICODE - Enter this code to claim +65 experience.
  • 5KMILESTONE - Enter this code to claim Minigunner Twitter Skin.
  • B1RDHUNT3R - Enter this code to claim Hunter Troop.
  • 1pumpkin - Enter this code to claim 1 Pumpkin Crate.
  • SPR1NGM1L3ST0NE - Enter this code to claim Springtime Skin.
  • HAPPY3AST3R! - Enter this code to claim Springtime Skin.
  • ELECTRO - Enter this code to claim 100 Coins.
  • SW33TXP - Enter this code to claim 100 XP.
  • 02MOMENT - Enter this code to claim XP.
  • MOARXP - Enter this code to claim XP.

How to Redeem Codes In Tower Defense Simulator

The process of redeeming codes in Tower Defence Simulator is quite similar to other Roblox games, so if players have previous experience, they shouldn't face any problems. For fans who are still confused about redeeming codes, there is a detailed guide below:

  • Launch Roblox: Tower Defence Simulator .
  • Press the button with the Twitter(X) icon located at the bottom of the screen.
  • Enter one of the above codes in the Enter Code Here field.
  • Click Redeem to receive the reward.

item.title: Roblox: Steal a Freddy Codes (August 2025)
item.description:
Steal a Freddy is a competitive FNAF -themed tycoon game where you need to buy, collect, steal others' animatronics, and protect your own. The more animatronics you have, the greater your passive income, so your status in the game depends on how well you defend your base and raid other players.

Redeeming Steal a Freddy codes is one of the few free opportunities to get cool rewards. As with other Roblox games, it won't take you long and will bring you useful items, so take advantage of this option before it's too late.

Updated August 19, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Right now, only one active code is available for Steal a Freddy , offering in-game cash. Its worth redeeming to boost your progress. More codes may arrive in the future, so checking back regularly is a good idea. Updates can bring fresh rewards at any time.

All Steal a Freddy Codes

Working Steal a Freddy Codes

  • GodBlock4You - Redeem this code to get in-game cash. (NEW)

Expired Steal a Freddy Codes

  • LuckyBlockLaunch - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • SpinToWin - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.

Redeeming Steal a Freddy codes is great for beginners and players with low activity. This way, you can literally provide yourself with good capital and other useful boosters for this Roblox game.

How to Redeem Codes for Steal a Freddy

Redeeming Steal a Freddy codes is not difficult, but before you do so, you must subscribe to the games official Roblox group. Then, use our guide to find out how to get rewards:

  • Launch Steal a Freddy .
  • Look at the upper left corner of the screen. There will be a Codes button. Click on it.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field and a green Redeem button next to it. Now, enter one of the working codes from the list above into the input field.
  • Finally, click on the green Redeem button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, the message Code successfully redeemed will appear on the screen, and the rewards will be credited to your account. If it doesn't work, make sure you didn't make any mistakes when entering the Roblox code manually, and make sure you didn't insert an extra space with the copy-paste function.

How to Get More Steal a Freddy Codes

To find more Steal a Freddy codes, just visit the game's official social media pages. The game's creators often share codes during updates or as a thank you to the community, so be sure not to miss these moments:

  • Official Steal a Freddy Roblox group.
  • Official Steal a Freddy Discord server.
  • Official Steal a Freddy X account.
